CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 10, 1945, pg. 23, reads: "Big Sisters - The Les Charmonts, a recently organized social club of Hill City plan to act as big sisters to the younger girls of the municipal organization. The club's main object will be an attempt to counteract juvenile delinquency in Hill District.  Pictured members of the club are, seated, left to right: Julia Carter, social chairman: Elinor Handy, publicity chairman: Marcha Thomas, vice president; Merdis Thomas, president; Betty Smith, corresponding secretary; Laura Higgins, treasurer.  Standing, left to right: Mamie Benton, Anne Thomas, Louis Allison, Mildred Williams, Dorothy Parrotte, Susie Harper, Montrose Brooks and Lillian Avery. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members of Les Charmonts Club, seated from left: Julia Carter, Elinor Handy, Martha Thomas, Merdis Thomas, Betty Smith, Laura Higgins; standing: Mamie Benton, Anne Thomas, Louis Allison, Mildred Williams, Dorothy Parrotte, Susie Harper, Montrose Brooks and Lillian Avery, gathered in interior of Hill City
